meanings.definition: A loud, discordant noise made by a group of people.
meanings.sent1: The charivaried of the crowd at the concert was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The charivaried of the children playing outside could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The charivaried of the party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The charivaried of the construction site was like a symphony of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The charivaried of the market place was a cacophony of sounds.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, discordant noise as a form of protest or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: The protesters charivaried outside the government building.
meanings.sent2: She charivaried loudly to express her dissatisfaction with the decision.
meanings.sent3: The students charivaried during the school assembly to make their voices heard.
meanings.sent4: His car charivaried down the street, drawing attention to his frustration.
meanings.sent5: The animals charivaried in the zoo, demanding to be fed.
